definitions.text: a collection of objects laid on top of each other
(often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent
examples: he made a mint on the stock market
see the rest of the winners in our huge passel of photos

definitions.text: a large sum of money (especially as pay or profit)
examples: she made a bundle selling real estate
they sank megabucks into their new house

definitions.text: fine soft dense hair (as the fine short hair of cattle or deer or the wool of sheep or the undercoat of certain dogs)
battery consisting of voltaic cells arranged in series; the earliest electric battery devised by Volta
a column of wood or steel or concrete that is driven into the ground to provide support for a structure
the yarn (as in a rug or velvet or corduroy) that stands up from the weave
examples: for uniform color and texture tailors cut velvet with the pile running the same direction

definitions.text: a nuclear reactor that uses controlled nuclear fission to generate energy

examples: stack your books up on the shelves

definitions.text: place or lay as if in a pile
examples: The teacher piled work on the students until the parents protested
